attributes.action: Reduce the Overseas Aid Budget from 0.7% of GDP to 0.6% of GDP.
attributes.background: The UK Overseas Aid Budget at 0.71% is the 5th highest of all European countries.   I suggest that it is reduced to 0.6% and that the cash difference be invested in our NHS.   The reduction amounts to approximately Â£1.4bn p.a.and so would fund the increasing needs of the NHS on an annual need.
attributes.additional_details:
With increasing demands on the NHS through an ageing and increasing population, the NHS needs more money.   We spend 8.5% of GDP (based on 2015 data) against an average in Europe of 8.9% and are the 10th highest spender of 10 listed countries.   We are the 5th higher contributor to Overseas Aid of 10 listed countries.  Germany & France spend considerably less on Overseas Aid than the UK - but considerably more on their NHS.  
Sources:  Wikepedia & Kings Fund

attributes.action: Change the law from late miscarriage to stillbirth.
attributes.background: I myself have had a stillbirth at 34 weeks just 9 month ago and I was outraged to discover that any children born before 24 weeks are categorised as a miscarriage. I want this changed.
attributes.additional_details: Many people don't realise that at this time the mother must give birth to their baby which is often fully formed. They hold them, love them and name them and yet they are non existent is the eyes of the law. They will not be offered a birth or death certificate or a funeral. This is heart breaking for the parents and family. I would like the law changed from miscarriage to still birth from the day any mother has to physically give birth to a baby.

attributes.action: Stop outsourcing assessments for PIP and make fit for Mental Health sufferers.
attributes.background: The current assessment trivialises common issues like depression and anxiety and does not take these into consideration when deciding these claims. The form and the assessor only consider physical ailments and not how mental ability often prevent physical ability and is tantamount to discrimination.
attributes.additional_details: ATOS Healthcare also often misrepresent an individuals needs and conversations they have had during PIP assessments and this has been well documented in the press and many websites previously. Here are a couple of examples: http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/new-claims-of-atos-assessment-lies-are-tip-of-a-massive-iceberg/ and http://www.disabilitynewsservice.com/atos-nurse-lied-about-pip-claimant-attending-assessment-alone/

attributes.action: Stop the sale of hard wired electrical accessories to the general public.
attributes.background: Many house fires and potentially dangeous situations regarding the electeical installations in dwellings are caused by poor workmanship on electrical installations. The main reason for this is due to the availability of hard wired accessories to the general public, who then fit them themselves
attributes.additional_details: Many people will not touch the plumbing in thier house due to the possibility of a leak thus causing damage, but will happily tamper with the electrical installation of their own homes and sometimes others as they believe they know what they are doing but in reality, do not have the slightest clue and are totally incompetent to touch such systems. These people are putting peoples lives at risk everyday and are able to do so as anybody can purchase the equipment without proof of competence to fit

attributes.action: Make it law for drivers to slow down and move over when they see roadworkers
attributes.background: every year a number of recovery operators and roadside technicians and other roadworkers are killed because of people not giving enough room when we are working on motorways. when they see flashing orange beacons slow down and move over to the middle lane to give us enough room to work safely

attributes.action: Public enquiry:Investigate state of prisons. Bring British Army in to help staff
attributes.background: Prison staff are unable to cope with the safe running of our prisons. Staff and inmates safety must be priority. Promises of more staff have not been fulfilled. More training is needed for prison roles. Health and safety practice is poor. Begin a public enquiry. In the meantime; bring in our Army.
attributes.additional_details: Inmates rehabilitation is not to the standards that they could be. Inmates need guidance. The ratio of inmates per staff member is unreasonable. Thus, staff suffer and potentially risk their safety. Prison staff are over-worked and not paid enough in light of the work that they undertake. Inmates are often not in receipt of adequate care. The lack of rehabilitation of offenders affects all parts of our society. It is time to stop ignoring inmates and staff members needs.

attributes.action: Make audio recording in meetings about children and vunerable adults mandatory.
attributes.background:
Children, vulnerable adults and their carers are suffering. 
I am concerned about neglect, lying and professional backwatching in schools and care services. All meetings should be audio recorded and a copy given to those discussed, their carer and all attendees.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.communitycare.co.uk/2015/12/10/parents-allowed-record-child-protection-meetings/

Producing copies of an audio recording for all involved in meetings within the care/education system would reduce abusive behaviour, unprofessionalism, lying, inaccuracies and would help to stop recordings taken out of context and placed on social media.
No more hiding behind 'their word against ours'. Let's have proper transparency when it comes to our children's wellbeing and protecting our vulnerable.

attributes.action: Introduce a 'Safe Haven' law for abandoned babies in the UK
attributes.background: Around 500 babies are abandoned each year in the UK, that's 9 a week! Here in the UK its currently illegal to leave a baby in a safe place if the parent feels they can no longer look after them, but in all 50 states of America they have a 'Safe haven' law to protect vulnerable children and parents
attributes.additional_details:
The safe haven law allows unharmed children under 3 weeks of age to be surrendered anonymously and safely to a designated place with no questions asked. This insures that babies are not abandoned in cold or dangerous conditions or worse still neglected. 
Whilst this is a highly emotive issue, this law will not encourage pregnant women to abandon their children, what it will do is protect societies most venerable and those that need it most the babies. Please help me protect the these babies.

attributes.action: Make Universal Credit an optional benefit.
attributes.background: Many people will find they get less under Universal Credit than they would have done under one of the previous benefits that it replaces. While Universal Credit has a transfer top up amount up amount this will not do anything to help new claimants out in the future.
attributes.additional_details: Therefor it would be reasonable to request that the government does NOT make Universal Credit the only option by allowing people to choose either Universal Credit or the benefits that apply to them out of the 6 benefits that Universal Credit replaces.

attributes.action: Legalize the medicinal use and sale of Cannabis via prescription.
attributes.background:
Millions of people throughout the world and in the UK suffer from conditions of which Cannabis offers a significant and harmless relief. 
To name a few:
-Glaucoma
-Seizures (Dravet's syndrome)
-Alzheimer's Disease
-Multiple Sclerosis
-Arthritis
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.who.int/medicines/access/controlled-substances/6_2_cannabis_update.pdf

http://www.encod.org/info/700-MEDICINAL-USES-OF-CANNABIS.html

attributes.action: Redirect the estate of those who die intestate from Prince Charles to the NHS.
attributes.background: Currently Prince Charles receives the estate of those dying intestate (without a will or any relevant surviving relatives) in Cornwall. This petition requests the law is changed so that money is given to the NHS rather than to the prince.

attributes.action: Put FEMINISM WEEK on the National Curriculum: female role models in all subjects
attributes.background: As a fully qualified teacher I know first hand that some schools rarely teach about feminism at all. For just one week of the academic year, if we could teach not just the history of feminism, but celebrate the achievements of females today in every subject, we could inspire true equality in the U.K
attributes.additional_details:
Feminism is already on the rise: our education system should be at the forefront of the movement. Not just #heforshe and #equalpay trending on Twitter; but opening the minds of all students male, female and LGTBQ to believe in total equality for their generation, both at home and in the work place - so no matter what gender you are born, you can dream just as big, and command the same respect.

I am aware that teachers have to cover what is on the exams but one week will not interfere too much.

attributes.action: Change of Law: MPs must stand down after serving a constituency for 10 years.
attributes.background: Nearly 10% of current UK MPs have been active for over 25 years. Nearly 20% of MPs have been active for over 20 years. The world has changed vastly since 1996, yet nearly 1/5 of MPs have been serving since then. Excessive continuous service prevents real political change for the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The Rt Hon. Sir Gerald Kaufman, The Rt Hon. Kenneth Clarke, The Rt Hon. Michael Meacher & Dennis Skinner have been active since 1970 - nearly 37 years making decisions for our country. The term 'Father of the House' is unsettling. We should be a progressive country, not a frozen one. Change is healthy. Fresh ideas and fresh actions are needed now more than ever.

attributes.action: Fly the Union Flag on Government Buildings on Armistice Day
attributes.background:
Current recommendations from the Department for Culture, Media and Sport do not require government buildings to fly the Union Flag on Armistice Day, 11th November.
It is recommended for Remembrance Sunday, but the omission of Armistice Day from the list is an oversight that should be corrected.
attributes.additional_details:
Armistice Day is 11 November. We pause to observe the Two Minute Silence at 11:00 on this day every year because at the 11th hour, on the 11th day of the 11th month in 1918, World War I ended. During this time, we remember those who have made sacrifices for the freedom we enjoy today.

The British Legion recommends flying the flag on Armistice Day.

http://support.britishlegion.org.uk/app/answers/detail/a_id/263/~/remembrance-faqs
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/designated-days-for-union-flag-flying

attributes.action: Set a time limit of 2 weeks on JSA and ESA decisions to reduce claimants' stress
attributes.background: The film "I, Daniel Blake" gave a vivid and true-to-life description of the possible consequences of long delays waiting for official decisions from the Job Centre et al. The system appears designed to grind down claimants, and cause the greatest hardship. The current system is cruel and degrading.

attributes.action: Private companies must allow 10 minutes before issue of a parking invoice.
attributes.background: Many retail parks, housing developments and busimesses use private parking companies to control parking in their carparks or roads. We believe these companies should be legally required to allow the driver to overstay by a maximum of ten minutes, just as traffic wardens and council wardens have to.
attributes.additional_details: If you are held up at the till because there are not enough staff at the checkouts, is it fair to be charged by the parking company that the store employs? Is it right to receive a ticket because you pulled up at your door to unload shopping before taking your car to the official car park? No, it isn't. These charges are exhorbitant and unfair. They should have to allow at least a few minutes grace before pouncing and issuing a fine.

attributes.action: Change the way Tax Credits are calculated to stop overpayments
attributes.background:
Tax credits are state benefits that provide extra money to people responsible for children, disabled workers and other workers on lower incomes.
Have you ever had an over payment for Tax Credits even though you advised them straight away of your change of circumstances as they asked? read on..
attributes.additional_details:
Have you ever received an over payment for Tax Credits?
This is because HMRC calculate your entitlement over a 12 month period they predict that your situation will remain the same for these 12 months, so if you then change your circumstances more than likely you will get an over payment usually in the Â£100's.
I suggest they calculate it weekly or monthly and remain the same each week/month unless we advise them of any changes and hopefully see over payments Â£10-30 instead of putting us in debt.

attributes.action: Start making Gazumping Illegal.
attributes.background: We put in an offer for a House about 3 weeks ago it got accepted. Mortgage approved everything. Then Tuesday 1st November 2016 got told that someone put in a Higher  offer and that got accepted. So now left High and Dry.
attributes.additional_details: We don't want this happening to other people

attributes.action: Allow Ambulances with a patient on board the right to use bus lanes any time.
attributes.background: As Ambulance crew it is very frustrating to have to sit in a endless queue of traffic with a patient on board who although may not be in a life threatening condition may be distressed or in pain while a empty bus lane is available. If empty Taxis and solo mopeds can use them then why not a Ambulance

attributes.action: make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when traffic jams are a mile back.
attributes.background:
To make the dartford tunnel/crossing free when tailback/traffic jams are a mile back.
We shouldn't have to pay for something that should've been free years ago.
The highways agency and sanef should sort this out.
Doing away with the barriers has made traffic tailbacks worse!

attributes.action: Ban the use of driverless cars before it's too late.
attributes.background: They are danger to other road users. An absurd idea and will cause the death of many pedestrians that could of been avoided. If you don't want to drive then get a taxi. They are not safe for anyone other than the passenger.

attributes.action: As with perjury, hold politicians in contempt of the realm if they lie publicly.
attributes.background:
Perjury: the offence of wilfully telling an untruth or making a misrepresentation under oath.
If you lie in court you can be sentenced to a term of imprisonment of up to 7 years. 
If you are a politician however, who lies under oath religiously to the public, then you usually receive a promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We have recently seen the effect of such lies told to the country, yet those responsible for their gross misrepresentations continue to enjoy their profession having never been held legally accountable for the horrendous damage caused by their deceitful rhetoric. 

Make lying to the public, whilst in office, the same offence as lying in court.

attributes.action: Stop advancement of religion being considered a charitable purpose.
attributes.background: The law recognises the advancement of religion as a charitable purpose. Religion includes all faiths and none  it includes a religion that does not have a belief in God. Advancing any belief system alone should not be considered charitable activity.
attributes.additional_details: Some belief systems may help people but assessing whether the beliefs themselves achieve benefit is subjective.  Public money through gift aid should not be available for this. Religious organisations should have to show other public benefit to qualify as charity and should only be allowed to use public money for that other purpose.

attributes.action: Force the government to raise the threshold of inheritance tax to Â£1,000,000.
attributes.background: Current threshold for inheritance tax is Â£325,000. After that a 40% rate is applied.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.ons.gov.uk/economy/inflationandpriceindices/bulletins/housepriceindex/2015-04-14

https://www.gov.uk/inheritance-tax/overview

attributes.action: Raise awareness about Motorcyclist for drivers. Add a Section for Practical test
attributes.background:
Many Car drivers are not very aware of Motorcyclist. I have seen many fatal accidents and it is now time to raise awareness for learners and normal drivers.
If they fail to show any awareness about Motorcyclist they must retake their test.

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: A law that Family Courts factor evidence of Alienation Inducement in its ruling
attributes.background: Children being alienated from one parent by another is common in Family Court contact requests or custody cases. This is psychologically harmful to the child and prolongs the court process unnecessarily. There are many papers about Alienation Inducement and the consequent Parent Alienation Syndrome

attributes.action: Make 'Up To' internet package speeds illegal.
attributes.background: 'Up To' internet speed packages plague the UK market and are used as an instant 'get out of jail free card' if the companies oversell or over promise on what customers are expecting. Customers are not able to accurately compare speeds and often receive much lower than is stated.
attributes.additional_details:
Internet packages are often sold as 'Up To' speeds. A package 'Up to 100MBps' may in fact regularly provide 8MBps (8% of the expected speed). The Government should either:
A) Require the speed received to be no less than 80% of the speed advertised, (example "100MBps", min acceptable 80MBps)
Or
B) Force companies to sell at the minimal acceptable speed, (example "From 80MBps").
If the speed paid for is not met for more than 1 hour the customer should not have to pay for that days costs.

attributes.action: Allow Liverpool/Merseyside to have a referendum on independence.
attributes.background: Liverpool and its people have always felt disconnected from the rest of the country especially the south, I would like the government to look into the possibility of giving us a independence referendum.
attributes.additional_details: Many people in Liverpool feel apart from the rest of the country, this is well known.

attributes.action: To insist on a 100 year clause in any section 30 order for Scottish independence
attributes.background: David Cameron's government naively took the SNP at their word that the 2014 Scottish Independence Referendum was a, "Once in a generation," Event. It is therefore imperative that any future Section 30 order granted to the Scottish Government for this purpose contains a 100 year, no referendum clause
attributes.additional_details: A 100 year, no independence referenda, clause must be agreed upon to stop the continuous division of Scottish society and to bind participants to the result.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for an insurance company to use "Act of God" in their policies.
attributes.background: A colleague of mine had a tree fall down on to his car, he was fully insured and had not missed a payment. The company refused to pay out, stating it was an "Act of God". My colleague was left with a total write off that was worth scrap value and no choice but to pay thousands out for a new car.
attributes.additional_details: I want to stop insurance companies using this loop hole to cheat the hard working people of this country out of money and the cover they have paid for. We abide by the rules, we pay our taxes, we pay extortionate insurances premiums that keep on rising every year. We derserve to be respected and to have this loop hole made illegal for insurance companies to use.

attributes.action: Bring the National Insurance system in-line with that of Income Tax
attributes.background: The weekly amount of pay after which all employees have to start paying National Insurance contributions has not been increased in line with the 'headline-grabbing' increases to the Personal Allowance for Income tax and represents a major penalty to business, especially those who employ themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'Primary Earnings Threshold' (weekly earnings) for commencement of National Insurance contributions has increased by an amount of just Â£16 since 2011/12; an increase of just over 10%. https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516787/Table-a4.pdf 
The Personal Allowance for Income Tax from over the same time to 2017/18, by contrast, represents an increase of over 50%.
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/516769/Table-a1.pdf

attributes.action: Reverse share dividend tax hike.
attributes.background: How can the conservative Government make tax breaks on shares look very attractive, encouraging the public buy them in April 2016. Then change the rules after the share prices have plunged due to Brexit. #very wrong

attributes.action: Debate homes sold to anyone outside of UK to carry a stamp duty levy of 50%.
attributes.background: Londonâs housing market has become a âsafe havenâ for corrupt money from across the world that is contributing to the crisis in home ownership in the capital, a report has suggested.
attributes.additional_details:
Transparency International, an anti-corruption group, said that it had found evidence that 1,616 of the homes in 14 developments it examined in central London had been bought by individuals or companies registered abroad, compared with 450 registered to Britons.

It added that 40%of the purchases, totalling Â£1.6 billion, were bought by investors from countries with a âhigh riskâ of corruption.

We owe it to our children, the next generation, to act now before our country is sold off!!!

attributes.action: Reduce the house of Lords to an equal number of MP
attributes.background:
How can so many unqualified people who are unelected have a direct influence over policy made by elected MPs? 
Reducing the numbers will save huge costs and leave qualified people who are accountable to Parliament. There should never be more Lords than MPs.
attributes.additional_details: Members of Lords to be selected by committee every 4 years

attributes.action: Review the sentencing length of crimes and abuse committed by care workers
attributes.background: Recent articles published concerning persons at risk who have been abused by care workers have received minimal sentencing after being found guilty of the crime.  Persons at risk and families should feel safe by the care provided and not intimidated by inappropriate behaviour of care staff
attributes.additional_details:
Community Care article - Poor training of care home staff leaving residents at risk, investigation finds.
28.10.15
The Guardian - Care Homer worker jailed for abuse of 89 year old caught on hidden camera - received only 4 months

attributes.action: Increase the funding of the cadet forces of Britain
attributes.background: The cadets are poorly funded and that's not good so more money would be nice so we can all get susats and jetboils

attributes.action: Tougher punishment for crimes against teens/adults with autism/mental health.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of reading about teens and adults being targeted and on occasions killed because they are vulnerable and an easy target, they may have mental health issues/autism/learning difficulties but they are human and have enough in their lives to deal with without being attacked.
attributes.additional_details:
My son is 16 and has Autism, I worry every day about him being bullied, assaulted or attacked because of his disability.

I read an article recently that truly sickened/shocked and upset me that there are human beings out there that think it's ok to tie a teenager with special needs upside down from a tree and beat them to death, words truly fail me.

Punishment for this type of crime is too lenient, especially for teenagers who think it's a laugh to publicly humiliate vulnerable/disabled people.

Teens and adults with Autism, learning difficulties and mental health issues should feel safe and protected as not all of them have a 24hr carer or a guardian angel watching over them all of the time.

Please sign this petition and keep the vulnerable safe.

attributes.action: Review Police policies instantly rejecting candidates with visible tattoos
attributes.background: Current policies for recruitment within the force is to completely reject candidates, regardless the level of application, if the person has visible tattoos irrespective of their nature.They are looking to diversify by employing new recruits from different cultures but are contradicting that message
attributes.additional_details: Its worrying that people are being judged on appearance and not ability, if the tattoos are non offensive. Statistics show that in 2015 approximately one in 5 uk people have tattoos, this figure set to rise dramatically by 2025. Peoples attitudes to tattoos are changing and if the Home Office don't look at altering the current policies they are not only restricting good quality candidates but could find that police may be excluding themselves from certain communities within their jurisdiction.

attributes.action: Withhold aid from countries, such as Uganda, where homosexuality is a crime.
attributes.background: In many countries LGBT people suffer persecution simply for being what they are. They are disowned by their families and suffer death threats from relatives. They have no protection in law, instead police harass them and arrest them. They are in continual danger of prosecution and imprisonment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Pakistan

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Uganda

attributes.action: Introduce and enforce a trade embargo on Saudi Arabia.
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia have an appalling human rights record. Homosexual acts are punishable by death and women are treated legally as second class citizens. In addition to their medieval society, there is evidence that the Saudi regime funds Sunni terrorists organisations. We cannot do business with them.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/saudi-arabia/local-laws-and-customs
"The Saudi legal system differs in many ways from the UK. Suspects can be held without charge and are not always allowed quick access to legal representation. The Saudi authorities have detained witnesses and victims of crimes."
"It is illegal for women to drive."
"The public practice of any form of religion other than Islam is illegal"

attributes.action: UK government vote of no confidence.
attributes.background:
lets send a strong massage to the torries that we have no confidence 
 in them to run our affairs in Scotland and UK wide.
we demand as one people the conservative party steps down.

attributes.action: Funds to support community fridge's around the U.K.
attributes.background:
To have community fridges available to help homeless and people on low income or unemployed. 

Allow businesses and public to donate unwanted food into community fridges to help people who can't afford or struggling to feed family.

attributes.action: Allow small businesses to have the same consumer rights as an individual.
attributes.background: Small businesses are being targeted by larger businesses to unfair contract terms, outrageous drop out penalties/clauses & higher prices. Yet, because we are a small business we have little or no consumer protection. Help make this change and allow a fairer marketplace for small business consumers.

attributes.action: Ensure that the triple lock on the Basic State Pension is removed.
attributes.background:
The triple lock is a guarantee to increase the state pension by a minimum of 2.5% a year. 

Guaranteed rises in the state pension worsen generational inequality.
attributes.additional_details: With the EU Referendum in mind it is more important than ever that we are all affected equally by our economic policy decisions.

attributes.action: Allow students undertaking work experience the right to accept/be paid
attributes.background: As of right now students who need to undertake work experience in order to complete their course are unable to accept pay from their work experience. Students have to take a large amount of time off from their usual jobs to complete work experience and most will miss out on a large amount of pay.
attributes.additional_details: Missing work, means missing pay and for some missing pay is the difference between being able to pay rent or not, being able to afford bills or even being able to afford food.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions on Trump and his cabinet if they withdraw from or ignore COP21.
attributes.background: Individuals in the current US administration have in the past shown disregard for scientific data on climate change and are signaling they might not follow on US commitments taken at the COP21 agreement. The UK should consider putting such individuals on the list of financial sanctions target.

attributes.action: Divert our "special relationship" from USA to Mexico.
attributes.background: We have a "special relationship" with America. It means nothing at all - there are no favours through that relationship.
attributes.additional_details: It is symbolic and I donât think we should be symbolically aligning to somewhere run by someone who makes inappropriate remarks about children, who imposes executive orders which may be illegal.

attributes.action: Focus a larger portion of the defence budget on service personel.
attributes.background: Early terminations from the armed forces is at an all time high. The priorities of the chain of comand are certainly proportionally aimed at staff retention. However new legislation brought by the Army2020, such as, the planned scrapping of the commitment bonus scheme contradicts this completely.
attributes.additional_details: Other plans such as the increase in prices for SFA to bring it into line with the private housing market are evidence of the mindless eradication of the few remaining factors that keep todays service men and women HAPPY to remain in the services. Pensions, pay, accommodation cost, catering contracts, SFA standards, the CarillionAmey contract for the MoD estate. ALL of these points need addressing in order to provide the level of retention the army needs to function.

attributes.action: If a person has a multiple birth they should be given more time off work.
attributes.background: Why should you get 1 year off for one baby and the same amount of time for more than one. If someone has multiples it's really hard to bond or even get in a routine.
attributes.additional_details: It's stressful trying to find childcare for more than one baby also while there only 9 month I really believe multiple mums should get more time off work
